channel.title: Run problem
channel.description: when ever i run my client it says this [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/birvrc.png[/img] how do i fix this?

item.title: Run problem
item.dc:creator: @broyou9222 broyou9222
item.description:
@broyou9222 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:7, topic:519173”]Does the client still pop up?
Can we see the code inside of that specific batch file?
We need more information in order to help you.[/quote]

ive also did this code

@echo off
title client - Loading
color 0a
cd bin

:start
echo.
echo ------------------------------------------------
echo Client (x64), Starting up…
echo ------------------------------------------------
if exist “%HOMEDRIVE%\Program Files (x86)” goto x64
goto x86

:x64
title client (x64) - Loader
echo Auto-Detected 64-bit (x64) System
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo . C l i e n t o u t p u t b e l o w .
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo.
“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

:x86
title Client (x86) - Loader
echo Auto-Detected 32-bit (x86) System
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo . C l i e n t o u t p u t b e l o w .
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo.

“%HOMEDRIVE%/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe” -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

i get this error now

before it was this code

@echo off
java -cp bin -Xms812m -Xmx1024m client 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Run problem

item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Can we see the code inside of that specific batch file?
We need more information in order to help you.

item.title: Run problem
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:519173”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=637632.msg4297907#msg4297907 date=1368528077]

that my good man…means it compiled successfully.

because compiling is the same as running the client
[/quote]he probably just didn’t realize which one is the client and which one is the server, or even better somebody thought it would be funny to make the compiler be named run or something. :rolleyes:(I have seen that before)

if he wants we can easily confirm if he posts the compiler…er I mean run…[/quote]

Not everybody is that retarded. I’ve had a similar sort of problem like this before; my solution was to use a different client because that’s what leechers like me do!

Read full topic

[/quote]

because compiling is the same as running the client[/quote]he probably just didn’t realize which one is the client and which one is the server, or even better somebody thought it would be funny to make the compiler be named run or something. :rolleyes:(I have seen that before)
